emergency
methods.docblock: System is unusable.

methods.name: alert
methods.docblock:
Action must be taken immediately.
Example: Entire website down, database unavailable, etc. This should
trigger the SMS alerts and wake you up.

methods.name: critical
methods.docblock:
Critical conditions.
Example: Application component unavailable, unexpected exception.

methods.name: error
methods.docblock:
Runtime errors that do not require immediate action but should typically
be logged and monitored.

methods.name: warning
methods.docblock:
Exceptional occurrences that are not errors.
Example: Use of deprecated APIs, poor use of an API, undesirable things
that are not necessarily wrong.

methods.name: notice
methods.docblock: Normal but significant events.

methods.name: info
methods.docblock:
Interesting events.
Example: User logs in, SQL logs.

methods.name: debug
methods.docblock: Detailed debug information.

ScraperBelt\\ScrapeCaser\\ScrapeWatcher.name: ScraperBelt\ScrapeCaser\ScrapeWatcher
ScraperBelt\\ScrapeCaser\\ScrapeWatcher.docblock:
Watcher
A class to "watch" special cases of a Scraper/Keeper target over time
in order to mitigate the effects of human error on the data source side.
A Watcher is invoked, set, checked and unset by a Scrape process
depending on Cases set by a Caser.
The Watcher simply `touch()`es, `is_file()`es and `unlink()`s a file at the given path.
